author: Reformer Staff
title: BUHS boys strike MVL gold
text:
BUHS boys strike MVL gold 
Reformer Staff Posted: 10/21/2015 07:49:12 PM EDT Updated: 10/21/2015 07:49:13 PM EDT Click photo to enlarge Brattleboro's Sarah Gallagher runs to a second place finish during Tuesday's Marble Valley League Championships in Manchester. Gallagher was just three seconds behind champion Erica Hale of MAU. « 1 » 
MANCHESTER >> The Brattleboro Union High School boys won the Marble Valley League A Division cross-country championship on Tuesday at Skinner Hollow Farm. The Colonels scored 33 points and were followed by MAU (56), Rutland (57) and host BBA (96). 
Isaac Freitas-Eagan finished third overall in 18:30 to pace the purple and white. Also scoring for Brattleboro were: Josh Meachen, 4th, 19:09; Jonah Koch, 6th, 19:15; Colin Costa-Walsh, 9th, 19:59; and Trevor Kipp, 11th, 20:07. Dan Burdo and Tyler Clement were the sixth and seventh finishers respectively for the Colonels. 
Burr and Burton's Anders Proft won the race in a course record time of 18:20. Rutland's Matt Lorman earned silver with a time of 18:25. 
There was a serious battle in the girls team race, with host BBA (40 points) edging MAU (41) when the dust settled. Brattleboro scored 69 points to earn bronze and Rutland finished fourth with 72 points. 
Brattleboro's Sarah Gallagher was one of three runners who broke the course record, placing second in 22:39. MAU's Erica Hale broke the tape in 22:36 and MAU's Paige Greenwalt wound up third in 22:46. 
Liz Morse (10th in 23:49), Emilia Dick-Fiora (14th in 24:08), Catey Yost (17th in 24:30) and Mollie Patenaude (33rd in 27:52) rounded out Brattleboro's top five. Kata Blakeson finished sixth for the Colonels and Annie Takacs was the team's seventh across the line. Advertisement
